data.question: What is the empirical formula of AzoMOF?
What is the crystal system of AzoMOF?
At what temperature (K) was the single crystal X-ray diffraction analysis of AzoMOF conducted?
Does AzoMOF undergo photoisomerization upon irradiation with UV and visible light?
What is the isosteric heat (Qst) of CO2 adsorption in AzoMOF15% at zero coverage?
Is the isosteric heat of CO2 adsorption higher in AzoMOF15% compared to AzoMOF1%?
What effect does the cis-isomer content have on the diffusion kinetics of CO2 in AzoMOF?
data.answer: The cis-isomer content significantly affects the diffusion kinetics of CO2.

data.question: Does the adsorption profile of Ar change significantly upon photochemical conversion of AzoMOF1% to AzoMOF15%?
What is the role of erythrosine B (EB) in the study of AzoMOF?
data.answer: EB serves as a polarity-sensitive probe.

data.question: Does the interior environment of AzoMOF become less polar as the trans-isomer content becomes higher?
What is the main difference in the adsorption profiles of AzoMOF for CO2 and Ar?
data.answer: CO2 experiences a dominant effect of a polar effect rather than a steric effect in the crystalline nanochannels.

data.question: Can the photoisomerization of AzoMOF be repeated multiple times without any noticeable fatigue and structural failure?
What is the half-life (τ1/2) of the cis-azobenzene unit attached to the pillar linker in AzoMOF at ambient temperatures?
What is the photostationary state cis-isomer content of AzoMOF upon UV irradiation?
Does the adsorption of CO2 in AzoMOF decrease when the cis-isomer content increases?
What is the effect of the cis-isomer content on the diffusion event through the triangular window in AzoMOF?
data.answer: The cis-isomer content influences mostly on the diffusion event through the triangular window.

data.question: Is the BET surface area of AzoMOF1% substantially different from that of AzoMOF15%?
What is the dipole moment of cis-azobenzene compared to its trans isomer?
data.answer: The dipole moment of cis-azobenzene is approximately 3.1 D, whereas that of its trans isomer is nearly zero.

data.question: Does the amount of adsorbed CO2 in AzoMOF15% become smaller than that in AzoMOF1%?
What is the main conclusion regarding the effect of azobenzene isomerization in MOFs on the diffusion kinetics of gaseous molecules?
data.answer: The isomerization exerts a significant effect on the diffusion kinetics of CO2 but not on that of Ar.
